Daytime: in the magic beneath a veiled sun
the earth is my mother and the sun is my father
clouds began to shut down the sun
the hills were blazed in gentle apricot light
indigo hues deepened as daylight wanes over hills and fields
Latin: Si enim posset imaginari avolabunt in luna
unquam imaginari posse, est maior in terra quam tibi
Nos mos ledo una die dissipatur meteoron
Credo in te, et eris beatus
Nighttime: the distant stars magnified the silence
carry me to the edge of the moon
one by one the stars winked in the darkening sky
the big dipper heavy in the western sky
